questions.question: A wire under tension vibrates with a frequency of 450 per second. What would be the fundamental frequency if the wire were half as long, twice as thick and under one-fourth tension?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Recalculate using frequency formula considering radius and tension.
explanations.b: Close, but not exact. Review √T and μ ∝ r² effect.
explanations.c: Correct. Accounts for all changes in string length, radius, and tension.
explanations.d: Not the right value. Double-check units and square root factors.

questions.question: The equation of transverse wave in a string is: y = 8 sin [1.256x - 25.12t] cm. What is the amplitude of the wave?

explanations.c: Correct. Amplitude is the coefficient before sine.

explanations.a: Correct. Seebeck effect governs thermo emf generation.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Peltier relates to heat at junctions, not emf.
explanations.c: Related but not the primary cause of thermo emf.
